page.title: 11THOLOMAS DROVE
page.content: Until the 1930's Tholomas Drove was a hamlet in its own right,with a fire engine and station, school, shop and post office. Since then the hamlet has declined in importance and become an out-post of Wisbech St.Mary. The school building still stands, but is now used as a barn. French Cottage, built for the Headmaster, is now occupied by John Brackenbury former landlord of the Bridge Inn. Jubilee Farm, formerly known as Calves Field Farm, is now owned by the Ball family. In the 1930's the farm was divided into six fields, growing a variety of crops which were farmed by six workers, but now there is only one field farmed by one person. Tholomas Drove was, and still is, a close-knit community comprising mainly of the same families generation after generation.
